meanings.definition: A heavy or bulky thing that is being carried or is about to be carried.
meanings.sent1: The truck struggled under the heavy load of bricks.
meanings.sent2: The workers unloaded the truck filled with a heavy load of supplies.
meanings.sent3: The load of laundry seemed to have multiplied overnight!
meanings.sent4: Her responsibilities felt like an overwhelming load on her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The load of books threatened to topple over.

meanings.definition: The amount of work to be done or the amount of work that a person or machine can do.
meanings.sent1: The students had a heavy load of homework to complete.
meanings.sent2: The machine was designed to handle a large load of tasks efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The load of paperwork on his desk never seemed to decrease.
meanings.sent4: The load of responsibilities on her plate was immense.
meanings.sent5: The load of assignments felt never-ending.

meanings.definition: A quantity of something that can be carried at one time.
meanings.sent1: The truck was filled with a large load of fresh produce.
meanings.sent2: She carried a small load of groceries in her arms.
meanings.sent3: The load of apples in the basket looked tempting.
meanings.sent4: The load of presents for the party was carefully wrapped.
meanings.sent5: The load of firewood was neatly stacked by the fireplace.

meanings.definition: A weight or force that is supported by something.
meanings.sent1: The bridge was designed to withstand a heavy load of traffic.
meanings.sent2: The beam supported the load of the roof without any issues.
meanings.sent3: The load of books on the shelf made it sag slightly.
meanings.sent4: The load of snow on the roof caused it to creak under the weight.
meanings.sent5: The load of dishes in the dishwasher clinked softly as it ran.
